summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding scheduling a meeting and obtaining approval for a travel approval form related to the Epstein case. The emails discuss delays, coordination of signatures, and a memo concerning travel to Sweden.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting approval for an Epstein-related travel approval form and a memo concerning travel to Sweden. They are coordinating a meeting.

events.title: Travel Memo Submission and Meeting Attempt
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney submits a travel memo related to the Epstein case, noting unexpected delays in obtaining OIA approval. They attempt to schedule a meeting for final DOJ approval.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Meeting Coordination for Travel Approval
events.description: Multiple emails are exchanged to schedule a meeting, ultimately settling on February 4th at 1:00 PM, to discuss and obtain signatures for the Epstein travel approval form.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The correspondence is focused on obtaining approval for a travel approval form related to the Epstein investigation.
A specific memo concerns travel to Sweden, indicating international investigative steps were being taken in early 2020.
The emails reveal bureaucratic coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office, involving OIA and final DOJ approval.
The communication shows active case work occurring in February 2020, after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
